Password forgotten: In case you have forgotten your password, you can reset your account by using your Email. Type in your email address, so we'll send instructions on how to reset the password.

Title: Title:
Are you certain that you want to delete: Are you certain that you want to delete the note?
Application description: The application enables storing of 'memory tracks', i.e. relevant notes, links etc. to be searched and obtained later when needed.
User account needed: You will need a user account to be able to manage notes on the system. On the image below you will find the registration component where you have to fill in at least an email address that is used as your username as well as a password. After you have finished the registration, you will have to log in by using your credentials.
Handling notes: Basically you may maintain notes with a title, description and a set of keywords in the system. Those are stored to a MongoDB database and fetched through an API to be viewed on the frontend. Moreover, the conventional options to edit or remove existing notes are included. See the screenshot below
Instructions for adding a note: You will have to provide at least a title and some content to a note. It is also recommended to add some keywords as well to enable the search for notes by keywords.
Keyword search: There is a keyword search functionality on the main page with which one may search notes by their keywords. Type in a keyword and click the button to execute filtering of the content.
Profile management: After you have logged in, you have an access to your personal profile. By clicking the icon with your name initials on the top menu bar, a profile page is opened. There you may change your personal data, e.g. name or email address as well as switch your current password.
Password reset request sent description: A request for a password reset has been submitted. Please check your Email for the instructions!
Are you certain that you want to archive: Are you certain that you want to archive the selected note?
